The Going Positive Game: Using Positive and Negative Numbers

Mr. Bernoski’s math classes are designing math games for their family game night. They designed the Going Positive Game, a game similar to a popular television game show.

Equipment

  • Going Positive board with categories and point amounts
  • Cards – point value on the front and question on the back. As the point values increase, the question difficulty increases.

Rules

Teams can be partners, small groups, or individuals

  • One team chooses a card with a point value of 50, 100, 150, 200, or 250.
  • The teacher asks the question on the back of the card.
  • The first team to answer the question correctly gets the point value on the card.
  • If a team answers incorrectly, the point value is removed from the team’s score.
  • For incorrect answers, other teams may try to answer the question.
  • The team that answers correctly chooses the next card.
  • The team with the highest score at the end of the game wins.
